2.5. To/From numpy.array

2.7. Save/Load

  • Show Source

2.6. Append elements¶

The size of Tensor can be expanded using Tensor.append.

One can append a scalar in to a rank-1 Tensor. For example:

  • In python:

1
2
3
4
A = cytnx.ones(4)
print(A)
A.append(4)
print(A)

  • In C++:

1
2
3
4
auto A = cytnx::ones(4);
cout << A << endl;
A.append(4);
cout << A << endl;

Output>>

Total elem: 4
type  : Double (Float64)
cytnx device: CPU
Shape : (4)
[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]


Total elem: 5
type  : Double (Float64)
cytnx device: CPU
Shape : (5)
[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 4.00000e+00 ]

Note

It is not possible to append a scalar into a Tensor with rank>1, as this operation is by itself ambiguous.

For Tensor with rank>1, you can append a Tensor into it, provided the shape is matching. This operation is equivalent as numpy.vstack.

For example, consider a Tensor with shape (3,4,5), you can append a Tensor with shape (4,5) into it, and the resulting output will be in shape (4,4,5).

  • In python:

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
A = cytnx.ones([3,4,5])
B = cytnx.ones([4,5])*2
print(A)
print(B)

A.append(B)
print(A)

1
2
3
4
5
6
7
auto A = cytnx::ones({3,4,5});
auto B = cytnx.ones({4,5})*2;
cout << A << endl;
cout << B << endl;

A.append(B);
cout << A << endl;

Output>>

Total elem: 60
type  : Double (Float64)
cytnx device: CPU
Shape : (3,4,5)
[[[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]]
 [[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]]
 [[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]]]


Total elem: 20
type  : Double (Float64)
cytnx device: CPU
Shape : (4,5)
[[2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]
 [2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]
 [2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]
 [2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]]


Total elem: 80
type  : Double (Float64)
cytnx device: CPU
Shape : (4,4,5)
[[[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]]
 [[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]]
 [[1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]
  [1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 1.00000e+00 ]]
 [[2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]
  [2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]
  [2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]
  [2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 2.00000e+00 ]]]

Note

You cannot append a complex type scalar/Tensor into a real type Tensor.
